definition[0]: to twist and pull something roughly from the place where it is being held
example[0]: I wrenched the packet from his grasp.
example[1]: The door had been wrenched open.
definition[1]: to hurt a joint in your body by twisting it
example[2]: I think Iâ€™ve wrenched my knee.
definition[2]: a metal tool that you use for turning nuts
definition[3]: a strong feeling of sadness that you get when you leave a person or place that you love
example[3]: Leaving New York had been a terrible wrench.
definition[4]: a twisting movement that pulls something violently
example[4]: He grabbed the rope and gave it a wrench.
